## **Description**
The **Pad **operator allows to extend the length of the input string to a desired value by adding a padding characted, based on the configuration settings.

## **Input**
**Input**

**Data Type**

**Description**

**in0**

String

The string that you want to extend by adding the padding character defined in the settings

## **Output**
**Output**

**Data type**

**Description**

**out0**

String

The resulting string, whose length has been extended by adding a padding character

## **![](data:image/png;base64,)****Settings**
- In the **Padding character **text field, type the padding character that you want to use.

- In the **Length **text field, type the length (i.e. number of characters) that you want the string to have.

- From the **Type **drop-down menu, select the side of the string to which the padding character should be added in order to reach the desired length. The available options are:

**Left**: Add the padding character before the first character of the string.

- **Right**: Add the padding character after the last character of the string.

- Click **Apply **to confirm.

## **Special cases**
In special cases, the operator behaves as follows:

**Case**

**Behavior**

**NULL input (no input)**

The operator considers a NULL input as an empty string. The system logs a warning event.
